body: @mistercrunch added support to use the mapping from vis type to vis file. i removed some components I had duplicated in explorev2, and also removed the new line chart in favor of using the existing viz files. i added an issue documenting the outstanding issues with wrapping the vis's in V2 and will make another PR with fixes for those. https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/issues/1341. PTAL!

node v4.2.6  
npm  v3.5.2
LGTM

we use node 6.2.2 and npm 3.9.5.

i updated contributing.md with these details.

https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1344
we also haven't found any issues with node>=5.10 and npm>=3.9.
LGTM
Fixed already, closing

@mistercrunch I've updated the code according to your comments. Please review again.

travis-ci timed out when building javascript (that should have nothing to do with this pull request)
Yep, I had a similar problem. I'd created a read-only MySQL account for Caravel to use but hadn't granted it the 'show view' privilege. Fixed that and Caravel happily pulled in the views.
@Thomasmisfit you ever have any luck getting Google OAuth to work with Caravel?
SQL Lab does that, the slice model also allows from a SELECT statement instead of a table (that's the way SQL Lab does it)

@jwthomp you'd have to allow set the flag to allow public users and add the datasource to the public role. As for embedding the dashboard, you can alter the CSS of the dashboard to hide the Caravel menu.

Which version of Druid introduced `segmentMetadata`? Is it supported by pydruid? 

We really want a good integration with Druid and will be happy reviewing/merging PRs that make improvements.
What's the database type of `BalanceDate`? If it's a string of some kind you may have to fiddle with these for your date column:
Does IE have weird issues with common URLs?

`segmentMetadata` is supported by `pydruid` but it doesn't support `merge` right now. 

Somebody has done a PR for `pydruid` already. I can ask them if it's possible to be merged. 

https://github.com/druid-io/pydruid/issues/64

If that's the case I can open a PR for improvement for Caravel. 

Thanks.
If you can reproduce it by providing a falling unit test I can look into it.
Careful here, there's no guarantee that a database name is unique. It'd be great to have a meaningful/readable yet unique ID for databases.

Oh interesting. Thanks for documenting / sharing. You can keep track of our npm dependencies and wether they are updated here:
https://david-dm.org/airbnb/caravel?path=caravel/assets
What's the database backend here? Looks to me like `DATE("inputDate")` should be using backticks, not quotes.

Any slice widget can broadcast filter events to the controller, it's just a matter of capturing the event and broadcasting the right thing.

I'm not sure how intuitive this would be but it wouldn't be hard to make it work. Say if you had 2 line charts and apply a time filter on one of the 2, user may expect no changes to the other chart, or some client-side cross filtering (which we don't and won't support).

If anyone wants to work on that feature, I'd like to have an extra boolean "Time Filtering Affects Dashboard" and have it unchecked by default.

I took some time to document "How to add dynamic filters to a dashboard?" in the FAQ, it's a bit burried and new, so you may not have found it.
http://airbnb.io/caravel/faq.html#how-to-add-dynamic-filters-to-a-dashboard

Depending on the behavior you want, I'd recommend using the `filter_immune_slices`or `filter_immune_slice_fields` configuration in your dashboard.
@mistercrunch what do you mean by common URLs? I can navigate through all the pages within caravel just fine, it's just the visualizations that aren't fetching correctly.

Thanks for the quick feedback! Definitely should've caught that nit, cargo-culted a little too hard there.

Will add tests tonight; since I was already in there I added a few for other reducer actions around QueryEditors - would you prefer those be separated out into another PR?

Thx for info i'll give it a try!

In that case this ticket could be used to somehow improve such setup - some kind of gui settings? (for people who don't feel well with any kind of markup :) )
Added more specs and tests as required. Ready for final review @bkyryliuk
https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1329
lgtm
Thanks a lot Maxime. Your very quick help was well above my expectation :)
A date picker wouldnt allow for relative dates which i think is important. Maybe eventually we can have a fancy React component that does both fixed and relative nicely.
Oh snap. We'll have to get rid of it.

Changing `import MapGL from 'react-map-gl'` to `import MapGL from 'react-map-gl/dist/map-gl.js'` in caravel/assets/visualizations/mapbox.jsx worked.
What are your npm and node versions?

We often point Airflow committers to this article bellow. Please take the time to read it as it's nice to have good commit messages (though no need to overdo it!), that makes for easier PR/project management, a good changelog and can even provide context while dealing with merge conflicts.
http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/

Was there any follow-up to this issue? I'm experiencing the same challenge, upgrading the database from eca4694defa7 to 3b626e2a6783 hangs...  

Postgres Version 9.5.3.  

Has anyone else been able to successfully upgrade the DB?
Oh interesting, I didn't hit that. What's your node and npm version?
ping!
this is pretty minor and well tested, mergin'

What I don't understand is that the builds on Postgres go through the migrations without any issues. Maybe it's because the tables are empty while they run on our side? A Postgres version issue?

It may help to find which exact line of the migration script hangs and research that specifically.

I installed caravel by pip install caravel. https://pypi.python.org/pypi/caravel
Last time the version is 0.9.0 and later I tried 0.10.0 and now I tried 0.11.0. The problem stays the same.
So this problem should not be waitting for validation. It is certainly a problem.

I've done a bit more fiddling with this issue this AM and found one interesting tidbit:  If the migration is run one-step at a time in sequence, the upgrade succeeds without hanging.  Perhaps there's something wrong with the branch/merge?  

My starting point was 'eca4694defa7'
I tried to just simply run upgrade, which should have installed 'ab3d66c4246e', '3b626e2a6783', 'ef8843b41dac' and 'b46fa1b0b39e', but it hangs when attempting to install '3b626e2a6783'.

However, running each upgrade individually, one-after-the-other worked just fine:
`./caravel/bin/caravel db upgrade ab3d66c4246e`
`./caravel/bin/caravel db upgrade 3b626e2a6783`
`./caravel/bin/caravel db upgrade ef8843b41dac`
`./caravel/bin/caravel db upgrade b46fa1b0b39e`

This isn't so much a fix as it is a workaround as I can't really explain what is going wrong with the straight upgrade...  but it solved my immediate issue.

Thanks for the PR!

I vote for adding a new field `database_id` that would be unique, non-null and based off of the database_name. No spaces or special character.

That would require a migration script that kickstarts the field and suffix number are added where there is uniqueness conflict on the "slugified" database name.

A `utils.slugify(name, model_column)` method could be generalized and reused wherever we need this.

Awesome! One elusive feature is for the column width to be set automagically based on the data. Basic html table to this, and it may be part of the reason why they are slow.

I guess we could try to estimate the needed width based on a sample of the data, but it seems like the component should just do this.
